content.description: An agronomist is an expert in soil management and crop production. A certain state hires an agronomist to investigate whether there is a linear relationship between a wheat stalk’s height and the yield of wheat. The agronomist collected data and used the data to test the claim that there is a linear relationship at a significance level of <math alttext="alpha equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The agronomist tested the following hypotheses.
content.question: <math alttext="H sub 0: beta sub 1 equals 0. H sub a: beta sub 1 is not equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>β</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>β</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math> The test yielded a <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 0.25. Which of the following is a correct conclusion about the claim?

choices.label: The null hypothesis is rejected because <math alttext="0.25 is greater than 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.25</mn><mo>></mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. There is sufficient evidence to suggest that there is a linear relationship between a wheat stalk’s height and its yield.

The null hypothesis is not rejected because <math alttext="0.25 is greater than 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.25</mn><mo>></mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. There is sufficient evidence to suggest that there is a linear relationship between a wheat stalk’s height and its yield.

The null hypothesis is rejected because <math alttext="0.25 is greater than 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.25</mn><mo>></mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. There is not sufficient evidence to suggest that there is a linear relationship between a wheat stalk’s height and its yield.

The null hypothesis is not rejected because <math alttext="0.25 is greater than 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.25</mn><mo>></mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. There is not sufficient evidence to suggest that there is a linear relationship between a wheat stalk’s height and its yield.

The null hypothesis is accepted because <math alttext="0.25 is greater than 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.25</mn><mo>></mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. There is sufficient evidence to suggest that there is not a linear relationship between a wheat stalk’s height and its yield.

content.answer: The null hypothesis is not rejected because <math alttext="0.25 is greater than 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.25</mn><mo>></mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. There is not sufficient evidence to suggest that there is a linear relationship between a wheat stalk’s height and its yield.

topic.text: 9.5: Carrying Out a Test for the Slope of a Regression Model

skill.text: Skill 4.E: Justify a claim using a decision based on significance tests.
